Class UserController

com.demo.eventify.user.UserController

  • Constructor Details

    • UserController

      @Autowired public UserController(UserRepository userRepository, UserService userService, UserMapper userMapper, JwtService jwtService, EventRepository eventRepository)
      The UserController function is responsible for handling all requests to the /users endpoint. It contains methods that handle GET, POST, and PUT requests.
      Parameters:
      UserRepository - userRepository Access the database
      UserService - userService Call the methods in userservice
      UserMapper - userMapper Map the user object to a userdto
      JwtService - jwtService Create a jwt token for the user
      EventRepository - eventRepository Access the database and retrieve information from it

  • Method Details

    • getUser

      @GetMapping("test") public String getUser()

    • getAllUser

      @GetMapping("all") public List<UserEntity> getAllUser()
      The getAllUser function returns a list of all users in the database.
      Returns:
      A list of userentity objects

    • getUserByEmail

      @GetMapping("mail") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Optional<UserDto>> getUserByEmail(@RequestHeader("Authorization") String token)
      The getUserByEmail function is a function that takes in an email address and returns the user associated with that email. it extracts the user mail from token, find user by email and return it after filtering it with DTO.
      Returns:
      The user by email

    • findUserByName

      @GetMapping("findName") public Optional<UserEntity> findUserByName(String firstName)

    • getUserSubscribed

      @PostMapping("/findSubscribedUser") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Optional<List<UserDto>>> getUserSubscribed(@RequestBody EventRequest request)
      The getUserSubscribed function is a function that takes in an EventRequest object and returns a list of UserDto objects. The EventRequest object contains the id of the event that we want to find all users subscribed to. We use this id to find the corresponding event entity, then we use it as an argument for our userRepository's findAllBySubscribedEvent function, which returns a list of user entities. We then map these entities into DTOs using our mapper class and return them in an Optional wrapper with status code 200 OK.
      Returns:
      A list of users who have subscribed to the event with id equal to request
